pullRequest.title: XRDDEV-862 Add member
pullRequest.bodyText:
https://jira.niis.org/browse/XRDDEV-862
https://jira.niis.org/browse/XRDDEV-1077
https://jira.niis.org/browse/XRDDEV-1080

Add member wizard
Fixes for actions for member in client list view
Removed duplicate code with delete and register actions
Small fixes for vuex store usage
More intelligent way of creating a state in vuex unit test
Debounce helper function
Fix for empty key name in csr request
Fix a mix up with csr & key+csr requests

commit.message: XRDDEV-862 Add skeleton functionality for dynamic wizard

Merge branch 'XRDDEV-1077' into XRDDEV-862-add-member

# Conflicts:
#	src/proxy-ui-api/frontend/src/global.ts
#	src/proxy-ui-api/frontend/src/locales/en.json
#	src/proxy-ui-api/frontend/src/views/Clients/ClientsDataTable.vue
XRDDEV-862 Fix select client dialog props
XRDDEV-862 Add delete client function for members
XRDDEV-862 Move delete client actions to shared component
XRDDEV-862 Move unregister client actions to a shared component
XRDDEV-862 Move select client dialog to ui folder

Merge commit '551f1fc1efab4bead473bd14a1283738893d84c7' into XRDDEV-862-add-member

# Conflicts:
#	src/proxy-ui-api/frontend/src/ui-types.ts
XRDDEV-862 Fix snackbar's possible undefined value error
XRDDEV-862 Fix a bug with csr generation
XRDDEV-862 Add key uses proper prop
XRDDEV-862 Update to add client wizard
XRDDEV-862 Remove dangerous and unused line

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,67 @@
+<template>
+  <div>
+    <LargeButton

@@ -0,0 +1,116 @@
+<template>
+  <div>
+    <LargeButton @click="confirmDelete = true">{{$t('action.delete')}}</LargeButton>
@@ -0,0 +1,170 @@ + + +
@@ -0,0 +1,170 @@ + + +

nodes.bodyText:
Actually it is possible to remove the if-clause and just:
This would set certificationService value each time (undefined if no value)
this.certificationService = val?.[0].name
This would work identical to what it is now.
this.certificationService = val?.[0].name ?? this.sertificationService;
Up to you what to do, but I'd change at least to that optional chaining in the first comment :)
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,170 @@ + + +

nodes.bodyText: You haven't touch this logic, but could refactor it like above

In general I find a bit inconsistent that async await is used here but everywhere else dealing with promises has been done the 'old way' (attaching then and catch handlers to the promise). Also if we have to use the async await here perhaps we're using the wrong approach in the first place.
Anyway using the old promise handling way inside async function feels a bit odd too. That could easily be changed to use await instead. The same goes for 'checkForValidSignCert' -function - maybe just use async await there too.
checkForValidSignCert may throw an error which would stop executing this thread.
Actually this return a promise, not true
I think using lodash cloneDeep should be avoided as there is task for getting rid of lodash
optional chaining or not using if block like above

nodes.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,297 @@ + + + +

nodes.bodyText:
Maybe this 999 could be addressed to a variable that tells better what is it for.
Like const NO_SELECTION = 999;
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,297 @@ + + + +

nodes.bodyText:
return this.addMemberWizardMode === AddMemberWizardModes.CERTIFICATE_EXISTS;
At somepoint there were problems using these shorthands. How about here?
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,178 @@ + + +

nodes.bodyText:
Instead of duplicating setting false values in both success and fail callbacks you could set finally-block and do those just once there.
I presume dispatch returns promise not sure though.

@@ -0,0 +1,99 @@ + + +
@@ -0,0 +1,280 @@ + + +

nodes.bodyText: If clause can be removed and just return the comparison result. Like above.

@@ -0,0 +1,280 @@ + + +

nodes.bodyText: I think these are empty string checks. We could write a utility function isEmpty and use that -> removed duplication here and below & easier to read code as the utility method name would describe what it does.
parameter type missing here and other watch-block methods
